title: Construction worker, teen wounded in Avondale shooting
content:
Avondale police are investigating a shooting in which two people were wounded, apparently in a vacant house near Lower Buckeye and El Mirage roads.
Shortly after noon Friday, two construction workers went to the house, in the 12200 block of West Mohave Street, to do work on behalf of the owner, according to Sgt. Mathew Hintz, Avondale police spokesman.
They encountered teenagers in the house.
The construction workers called 911 and tried to detain the teens, Hintz said.
One of the teenagers, a 15-year-old boy, had a gun, he said. In a struggle with a worker, the gun went off, Hintz said.
"We don't know if it was intentional or accidental," Hintz said.
The construction worker was struck once in the stomach. He was in critical condition at a hospital, Hintz said.
The teenager was struck in the hand and was in stable condition at a hospital, Hintz said.
Two other teenagers were held for questioning, Hintz said. Police were unsure, but there may have been a fourth teen in the house, he said.
